item.title: Elasticsearch Essential Queries
item.description: The following is an overview for querying Elasticsearch. Over the years I have tried to assemble developer notes for myself and my team on a variety of platforms, languages and frameworks, a type of cheat-sheet but with context, not a comprehensive how-to, but a decent 15-minute overview of the features we are most likely to implement in a given iteration. Explore the Elasticsearch official documentation: Search in Depth. Contents Motivation Following Along with Elasticsearch and Kubernetes Vocabulary Basic CRUD API Delete an Index Create an Index Create or Update a Document (Upsert) Get a Document Mappings, Types and Metadata Get Mapping Create a Mapping Searching Range Filtering Aggregations Counts Averages, Minimums and Maximums Percentile Percent by Rank Percent by Rank Interval Resources Motivation My team and I work with a lot of SQL-based data, from MySQL, SQLite and even our large Cassandra cluster, however, our reporting systems are built on Elasticsearch.
